name: sandranista
text: Cowboy sauce!

name: alejandroadam
text: don't be fooled, it's just prepackaged mayo and katsup.

name: geysershitdick
text: That's how they made Russian dressing in the restaurant I worked at that one week.

name: pigeon_street
text: It is my understanding that a 50/50 mayo/ketchup mix is called "fry sauce". Apparently it's a northwestern US thing. I've tried it on nothing more than a plastic spoon and it was delicious.

name: pigeon_street
text: Also: I waited three years to post that.

name: killingthejay
text:
Use a punctured condom for a Cowboy sauce dispenser at your next rodeo!

http://achewood.com/index.php?date=07082003

name: hellofyellin
text: http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v358/agoodlysize/BBQ1_lg.gif

name: hellofyellin
text:
[IMGS OFF]

I hate myself.

name: heccibiggs
text: Hahaha did you just completely make an image URL italicized?

name: theguitarhero
text: oh my god he did.

name: hellofyellin
text: I did.

name: afterward
text:
a chubby

for honesty.

name: soticoto
text:
Well, I chubbed his original for making a fortuitous mistake.
His image can still be seen now despite image linking being deactivated SOLEY because he used italics instead.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: Good on steak, pizza, burgers, fries...Cowboy Sauce is a winner!

name: methadone
text: "a handful of weary, wary..."

name: lastlarf
text: The hat hanging in the air as Ray tackles that guy was a nice touch.

name: howard
text: ptoo

name: catachresis
text: "Fine cakes and city-wine" is just the most redneck phrase ever

name: spinynorman
text:
The term "foo-foo water" was a genuine cowboy term of disgust for cologne or perfume.

These truly were kings of men.

name: cailetshadow
text:
Fine cakes and city wine are what slows a man down, sure as sure.
Actually, if anyone in Achewood can truly be accused of these vices it is indeed Ray.

name: saru
text: I'm actually pretty confident that Ray buys wine that was literally grown in the city, possibly in rooftop vineyards, just because wine grown in the dirty, uncivilized country-side isn't rarefied enough for him.

name: soticoto
text: He drinks the wine while ladies smoosh the cakes with their bottoms.

name: werewolves
text: Frenchie fart-water

name: ctrl-s
text: tick-pimps, boilbacks, and yard sleepers

name: bourbonsamurai
text: The term "yard-sleeper" is awesome. So evocative.

name: crinklebat
text: Boy, do I love city-wine.

name: mattfish
text: mmm, and fine cakes.

name: aaron_haynes
text: Panel 3 is so perfectly done. You can see the hat spinning.

name: cailetshadow
text: Actually you can't. Ray has moved so quickly that the hat still believes itself to be on the yard-sleeper's head.

name: rumblefish
text: I think the hat is just realising that something as amiss and is starting to glance around warily.

name: fmercury
text: 3000 dudes

name: jormungandr
text: What really makes this strip work is the ellipsis at the end, then: eyes up on ray chattering from cold/3-day adrenaline overdose.

name: presterjohn
text: Normally Onstad is so classy he does not repeat his neologisms and turns of phrase. For a phrase as awesome a cowboy sauce an exception can easily be made.

name: professorhazard
text: A comment left by professorhazard was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dovey, pantscomeoff, rowboat, Sleaw)

name: xiaomimi
text: It's certainly not Comic Sans, just some kind of straight-edged sans serif.  What's wrong with the usage of decimated?

name: foetus_punch
text: Decimated means to destroy one-tenth of something. It comes from a punishment occasionally employed in Roman martial law. When a legion or battalion attempted desertion as a whole (fairly common near the end of the empire), one tenth of the legion was killed by stoning. It is surprising Onstad made this mistake, and I feel a right asshole correcting him. Of course, I'm also smug.

name: xiaomimi
text: Well yeah, but that's etymology, not current definition necessarily.  I don't know if I'd call it a "mistake" so much as a widely-accepted figurative usage.

name: foetus_punch
text: A comment left by foetus_punch was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, rowboat, jollysaintpete)

name: xiaomimi
text: Man, whose technical definition?  All the dictionaries I have immediate access to include the secondary definition of "to destroy a large number of."  Let's be forthright here: this ain't about correctness, it's about thinking the original meaning is awesome.  I can dig that!  I light a sad little candle for the literal meaning of "literal" every damn night.  But still, it's unfair to rag on people for using the language as it is, rather than as it should be.

name: foetus_punch
text: A comment left by foetus_punch was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, professorhazard, Ariamaki)

name: professorhazard
text: A comment left by professorhazard was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dovey, goatmasterflash, Sleaw)

name: cypher
text: There's no real question of ignorance; Onstad may well have known the etymology but chose to use it here anyway, and despite the fact that it can indeed be used in its original sense, it is widely used today as meaning 'to wipe out a large proportion', not JUST 10% thereof. Sorry to be a dick, but...yeah.

name: foetus_punch
text: Dude, I just didn't want to engage in intellectual masturbation. Besides that, I just checked a dictionary and...well, xiaomimi is right. I mean, of I argued this I'd just be an elitist prick. A wrong elitist prick. I'm still going to use decimate in it's original meaning, but I won't be a douche about it. Je n'aime pas ce que vous dites, mais je defendre jusqu'au mort votre droit de le dire.

name: professorhazard
text: A comment left by professorhazard was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Sleaw, mattylite, gnjdfsgk)

name: foetus_punch
text: Language evolves. It is the nature of language to change and adapt according to new needs and outdated concepts. A bit of investigation (I work in the linguistics department of UBC) reveals that the very first english dictionary ever written (a latin-english "wordbook") listed decimate as "to destroy a large number of". It was written in 1543. Our language does not stagnate, and although etymology and root words are among my passions, the evolution of language is one of the most interesting processes possible. This is an example of how language has changed. In ancient Greece, this would be an incredibly grammatically incorrect word. Do you hold that we should correct it, because those ancient Romans have dumbed it down so much?

name: professorhazard
text: A comment left by professorhazard was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dovey, Sleaw, Lumus, Doc_Rostov)

name: foetus_punch
text: You have just ruined your own argument. You're holding that we should change how "decimate" is spelled, because the Romans screwed it up, but obviously we foolish mortals could never hope to change it's definition. If we can change it's spelling, why can't the definition change? It's a much more natural and easily accomplished process. Seriously. Were you thinking when you said that?

name: professorhazard
text: A comment left by professorhazard was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dovey, Sleaw, Lumus, Doc_Rostov)

name: foetus_punch
text: I was thinking it would be pretty funny for you to provide an actual response, rather than saying "witty" things that add nothing to your argument.

name: andyfaewatford
text: JESUS MARY AND JOSEPH! The most awesome thing you've ever seen is happenging at the top of this page, and you're arguaing about the correct use of the word 'decimated'. Why would you do this?

name: foetus_punch
text: I'm sorry. It is pathetic. I was considering saying "we are having an internet argument," but I have more to say. Such is life?

name: rowboat
text:
The funniest thing about this whole conversation (maybe the only funny thing about it, actually) is that there was absolutely nothing incorrect about the way in which the word "decimated" was used in this strip.

It was, however, fairly interesting to track the flow of the argument. Xiaomimi tried and tried again to talk some sense. When she realized that nobody was interested in sense, she politely ducked out and let the boys squabble over some kind of long-obsolete poop.

name: foetus_punch
text:
I am an obnoxious pedant. And...y'know, I was arguing for Xiaomimi after I realized she was right. But whatever. Disregard that.

Sorry for being a jackass. I'm done here.

name: rowboat
text: It was worthy of discussion. And besides, I welcome any excuse to hit up the old O.E.D., and this discussion gave me such an excuse.

name: dj_insomniac
text: As a wise friend of mine once wrote in his webcomic, "Arguing on the Internet is kinda like competing in the Special Olympics. Even if you win, you're still retarded."

name: foetus_punch
text: As I myself commented on the Internet, "That joke has been done many times. Write your own material, dj_insomniac's friend."

name: apocowarg
text: I really enjoyed this debate and I am sorry foetus_punch caught a few undeserved (in my opinion) lames during it.

name: foetus_punch
text: It looks like I got a few undeserved chubbies, too. Seriously, I was such a smug twat near the beginning there. God damn me. God damn me to hell.

name: layzerblade
text: His question that he asked sarcastically, to mock your original position? Yeah, real funny. And before you ask "why are you complaining, if you thought what I said was so funny?", [i]that was sarcasm again![/1]

name: foetus_punch
text: Layzerblade, I have just no idea at all what you are saying.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
You know what? Fuck all you assholes. Have you ever had dinner with this man ? I have.

I ain't got no fancy wordin' degree, but xiaomimi's got this one.

name: diggidy
text:
Perhaps ten percent of the acres was destroyed by fighting.
The field was literally decimated.

name: foetus_punch
text: Touched, my good man. Touched.

name: ariamaki
text: V-Chubby, for the fact that I am unsure-- Is that the past-form of touche with no accent, or being touched that he found a good explanation? Either way, good times.

name: foetus_punch
text:
It's actually a literal translation of touche (with an accent) from french to english.

But Ilike your explanations too.

name: tragicone
text: I can understand Ray's feelings in the last panel. That cold teeth chattering and shiver that will not give way for a number of hours. Never camp in Indiana in March.

name: budenhagen
text: I've camped in Indiana in January, it was Bad Times. Granted, the only reason I went in the first place was for the booze and the boobs... and I didn't get much of one and none of the other. Sigh.

name: tragicone
text: I feel dearly for you my brother

name: soticoto
text:
Is that barrel burning cowboy sauce?

I'd 5 this for sure if I could get some guarantee that Ray is keeping himself warm on the burning fats of the enemy...

name: tbtabby
text: The one who spits has abs like Pat.

name: dovey
text: That is dogshit.

name: deusoma
text: I watched Shawshank yesterday, so when I see that second-to-last panel, I automatically hear Morgan Freeman reading it. Weird.

name: dovey
text: Morgan Freeman is narrator of choice for almost anything worth narratin'

name: patrickjs5
text:
once again, Ray is drawn with blood on his hands...

he really does take after his old man.

name: direhaggis
text: In my heart of hearts, I want to believe that Ray somehow gathered up all those bastards, Squeezed their liquids into a barrel, lit the bastard, and tried to stay warm by it--cementing his stone cold rep all the more.

name: ctaronno
text: Is that Bono in panel two?

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Are you sure you don't mean The Edge, circa the PopMart tour?

[IMGS OFF]

name: fineoakstructure
text: Well shit.

name: tekende
text: I have to give Onstad props here. It's very difficult to properly draw a cowboy hat on someone's head.

name: duperando
text: Mmm. Sounds like a hella good thing to put on a cheeseburger.

name: elelevato
text: I'm still having trouble with the definition of "tick-pimp".

name: lolsworth
text: Do not fuck with Ray's friends.
